newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Autoindustries gets approval to buy firm.
newsitem.headline: Autoindustries gets approval to buy firm.

text.p: Malaysia's Securities Commission has approved Autoindustries Corp Bhd's proposal to acquire Custom Tooling & Engineering (S) Pte Ltd, the company's merchant banker announced on Thursday.
Commerce International Merchant Bankers Bhd said the Securities Commission has revised the proposal initially submitted by the company.
Under the approved proposal, Autoindustries will buy the entire equity of Singapore-based Custom Tooling for 8.92 million ringgit by the issue of 991,112 new shares at nine ringgit each.
Autoindustries had proposed a price of eight ringgit each, a statement from the merchant banker said.
The approval is subject to Custom Tooling not issuing any dividend or other distribution of its reserves to existing shareholders before the acquisition is completed.
Custom Tooling's main owner, Lee Peng Kai, is also required to provide a profit guarantee of 1.695 million ringgit for each of the three financial years up to March 31, 1999, the statement said.
